activities: Employee personal information is transferred from the EU to the U.S., including information in the employee's personnel file (e.g., contact information, home address and telephone number, work address and telephone number, work and compensation history, planned salary, earnings, career development, paid time off, salary grade, education, language preferences, relocation preferences, gender, emergency contacts, age, internal and external identificiation numbers, performance ratings, benefit program eligibility and participation information).  The information is collected for the purposes of payroll management, headcount, incentive and merit decisions, succession planning, organizational promotion and advancement, participation in benefit programs, and other traditional human resources, travel, and personnel functions.

recoursemech: Employees who have questions or concerns regarding the use or disclosure of personal information are encouraged to notify the Company's General Counsel. The Company will investigate and attempt to resolve any complaints or disputes regarding the use and disclosure of personal information. For employees located in the EU who may have complaints or disputes that cannot be resolved through internal processes, the Company has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by EU data protection authorities (EU DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner to resolve disputes pursuant to the Safe Harbor Principles.
